title: @RIOT: Rotating queue is an AWESOME idea, love it already, but one question...
body:
why only on weekends? 
I mean, wouldnt it make way more sense to say you put a mode in for a week and then change every week? 
Especialy in ways of balancing, that would make your job so much easier, since you could analyze one week of gameplay, the switch to another mode, and use the data collected to make mode specific changes to balance problem champions. 

Dont get me wrong, even if its just on the weekends, I am super happy and hyped, but I just feel like it could be done alot more... efficient :)

Anyway, thank you very much for this upcoming weekend fun

replies.body:
Hey Raoul!

Good questions :)

There's a few reasons we have chosen this kind of time frame. Typically the lifetime of the featured game modes (aka the actual activity in the queue) did not really match with the amount of time we were previously putting them on. So the idea is that we're going to more properly line up with the peaks and troughs of the game modes with this schedule. 

We chose weekends specifically to make it more accessible to most players. We will be analyzing the data from these runs to inform future runs of the modes!

Also as a note, we're not tied down by the schedule we announced. We're going to be monitoring the queue and activity and making sure that this schedule is appropriate, and if it's not, we'll adjust!

Even if the vast majority of players play on the weekend and they tire of the game mode by monday, there's still going to be a section of the playerbase who have a different schedule and won't be able to play at all. They could easily lose out on their favorite game mode when it shows up on the weekend they have a trip planned, or someone who works a weekend schedule and then misses out on all featured game modes. I would say if even .1% of the games played on a game mode happen during the weekdays, that's still a lot of actual people out there who just didn't have a chance to play the mode otherwise.

So I get the train of thought of putting game modes up for the "peak" amount of time... but I still disagree with its implementation. Yes, usage of a game mode may go down as time goes on (although no queue can separate me from my one true love URF), but then why not have it on the whole week, then rotate on weekends? Then you're getting not "most" players schedules, but rather practically *all* players schedules.

If queue activity goes down after 72 hrs, let it go down! There'll be another gamemode to bring it back to "peak activity" in just a few short days. 

It just seems that there really is nothing gained from having it on for only the weekends instead of the whole week, except to say you're making a "data driven" decision. Please correct me if I'm wrong though.

If these game modes are going to be limited to weekends only (Fri-Mon) then it seems like we're not really going to be seeing as much of them individually as we have in previous years.

Two appearances of URF in one year over two weekends assuming that a 'weekend' means Fri-Mon translates to 8 days of URF per year in total. In the last year we had 14 days of URF alone which is a lot more than what appears to be slated for 2016.
You forget that the entire fun of URF is when it comes out, and the couple days after. 2 Weeks of it gets a bit old towards the end.
hmmm... well, especially URF gets old pretty quick^^
I sense it might be so we don't get bored of them :P And also so we don't use our weekday time (that should be spent working or studying) playing these awesome modes!
